text.front:
Equilibrium Constants between Boron
Trifluoride Etherate and Carbonyl
Compounds in Chloroform Solution
J. J. Gajewski* and P. Ngernmeesri
Department of Chemistry, Indiana UniVersity,
Bloomington, Indiana 47401
gajewski@indiana.edu
Received June 20, 2000
ABSTRACT
Equilibrium constants for boron trifluoride complexation with carbonyl compounds relative to diethyl ether were determined in CDCl 3 . With
benzaldehyde the equilibrium constant is 0.208. There is a 1.28-fold preference for BF 3 bonding to benzaldehyde-D over benzaldehyde-H. The
G + value for complexation with substituted benzaldehydes is −2.0. Equilibrium constants with cyclohexanone and isobutyraldehyde were
found to be not very different from those predicted from the heats of addition of BF 3 relative to that for diethyl ether. The heats of addition
can be correlated with Taft's values and with ′ values.
ORGANIC LETTERS
2000
Vol. 2, No. 18
2813-2815
10.1021/ol000164k
CCC: $19.00
